page.title: 20RURAL MINISTRY MIDDLE RASEN
page.content: In recent years a complicating factor has caused adaptations of the parochial system. The central administration of the Church of England,the Church Commissioners, now administer all glebe, rents and patronage benefits, and fees are balanced as part of a rationization and balancing of stipends for both urban and and rural clergy. Hence, with modern transport, the Rural Ministry has become based upon several parishes. The parish priest thus covers a large area with a variety of village communities and hamlets. Within this context, mechanization and European Agricultural Policies create their own problems for the farming industry, therefore affect the economic stability, or otherwise, of the Rural Church.
